media.caption: the history of bitcoin

text.headline:
bitcoin
2009/01/03 - future
text.text: Since 2008, bitcoin adoption has been influenced by a diverse range of factors that have made it one of the most volatile currencies in the world. Yet, despite such volatility, more than 100,000 bitcoin transactions are taking place per day and the volume continues to grow due to the ‘permissionless innovation’ provided by bitcoin’s underlying technology, the blockchain.

media.caption: The Genesis Block is mined

text.headline: The Genesis Block is mined
text.text:
Block 0, the genesis block, is established at 18:15:05 GMT.


genesis block

media.caption: Bitcoin receives an equivalent value in traditional currencies.

text.headline: Bitcoin receives an equivalent value in traditional currencies.
text.text: The New Liberty Standard established the value of a Bitcoin at $1 = 1,309 BTC. The equation was derived so as to include the cost of electricity to run the computer that created the Bitcoins in the first place.

media.caption: Bitcoin pizza day.

text.headline: Bitcoin pizza day.
text.text: A programmer living in Florida named Laslo Hanyecz sends 10,000BTC to a volunteer in England, who spent about $25 to order Hanyecz a pizza from Papa John’s. Today that pizza is valued at £1,961,034 and stands as a major milestone in Bitcoin’s history.

media.caption: Bitcoin reaches $1 million.

text.headline: Bitcoin reaches $1 million.
text.text: Based on the number of Bitcoins in circulation at the time, the valuation leads to a surge in Bitcoin value to $0.50/BTC.

media.caption: Silk Road opened.

text.headline: Silk Road opened.
text.text: The Silk Road, an illicit drugs marketplace is established, using Bitcoin as an untraceable way to buy and sell drugs online.

media.caption: Bitcoin market capitalisation reaches $1bn.

text.headline: Bitcoin market capitalisation reaches $1bn.
text.text: Bitcoin market capitalisation reaches $1bn.

media.caption: The first major theft takes place.

text.headline: The first major theft takes place.
text.text: The first major theft takes place. Bitcoin Forum founder allinvain reports having 25,000 BTC taken from his digital wallet, which had an equivalent value of $375,000. In the same month, a major breach of security sees the value of the currency go from $17.51 to $0.01 per Bitcoin.

media.caption: Bitcoin price climbs to $700.

text.headline: Bitcoin price climbs to $700.
text.text: Bitcoin price climbs to $700 in as the US Senate holds its first hearings on the digital currency. The Federal Reserve chairman at the time, Ben Bernanke, gives his blessing to bitcoin. In his letter to the Senate homeland security and government affairs committee, Bernanke states that bitcoin “may hold long-term promise, particularly if the innovations promote a faster, more secure and more efficient payment system.

media.caption: China’s central bank bars financial institutions from handling bitcoin transactions.

text.headline: China’s central bank bars financial institutions from handling bitcoin transactions.
text.text: China’s central bank bars financial institutions from handling bitcoin transactions. This ban was issued after the People’s Bank of China said bitcoin is not a currency with “real meaning” and does not have the same legal status as fiat currency. The ban reflects the risk bitcoin poses to China’s capital controls and financial stability. Today China remains the world’s biggest bitcoin trader, with 80% of global bitcoin transactions being processed in China.

media.caption: Bitcoin custodians Elliptic launch the world’s first insured bitcoin storage service.

text.headline: Bitcoin custodians Elliptic launch the world’s first insured bitcoin storage service.
text.text: Bitcoin custodians Elliptic launch the world’s first insured bitcoin storage service for institutional clients. All deposits are comprehensively insured by a Fortune 100 insurer and held in full reserve. This means Elliptic never re-invests client assets; instead they secure them in deep cold storage. Overstock.com becomes the first major online retailer to embrace bitcoin, accepting payments in the US. Overstock was the first in what is now an expeditiously growing list of large businesses that accept bitcoin.

media.caption: The US government auctions off more than 29,000 bitcoins seized from the Silk Road.

text.headline: The US government auctions off more than 29,000 bitcoins seized from the Silk Road.
text.text: The US government auctions off more than 29,000 bitcoins seized from the Silk Road, the illegal online marketplace. The sale and closure of the marketplace marks growing institutional understanding of the potential use cases of bitcoin. Additionally, the closure and auction of the Silk Road has helped bitcoin gain legitimacy as it demonstrates that bitcoin is not an easy way for online criminals to avoid the rule of law.

media.caption: The ‘Bit Licence’ edges towards reality as the New York State Department of Financial Services releases.

text.headline: The ‘Bit Licence’ edges towards reality as the New York State Department of Financial Services releases.
text.text: The ‘Bit Licence’ edges towards reality as the New York State Department of Financial Services releases the first draft of the agency’s proposed rules for regulating virtual currencies. The European Banking Authority publishes its opinion on ‘virtual currencies’. Their analytical report recommends that EU legislators consider declaring virtual currency exchanges as ‘obliged entities’ must comply with anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorist financing requirements.

media.caption: Tech giant Microsoft begins accepting bitcoin payments.

text.headline: Tech giant Microsoft begins accepting bitcoin payments.
text.text: Tech giant Microsoft begins accepting bitcoin payments.

media.caption: The New York Stock Exchange is a minority investor in Coinbase’s $75M funding round.

text.headline: The New York Stock Exchange is a minority investor in Coinbase’s $75M funding round.
text.text: The New York Stock Exchange is a minority investor in Coinbase’s $75M funding round. The NYSE aims to tap into the new asset class by bringing transparency, security and confidence to bitcoin.

media.caption: The results of the UK Treasury’s call for information on digital currency are announced.

text.headline: The results of the UK Treasury’s call for information on digital currency are announced.
text.text: The results of the UK Treasury’s call for information on digital currency are announced.

media.caption: Gavin Andresen published BIP 101 calling for an increase in the maximum block size.

text.headline: Gavin Andresen published BIP 101 calling for an increase in the maximum block size.
text.text: Gavin Andresen published BIP 101 calling for an increase in the maximum block size. The changes would activate a fork allowing 8 MB blocks (with doublings every two years) once 75% of a stretch of 1000 mined blocks is achieved after the beginning of 2016.

media.caption: BitcoinXT version 0.11A was released to the public.

text.headline: BitcoinXT version 0.11A was released to the public.
text.text: BitcoinXT version 0.11A was released to the public.

media.caption: Bip 101 was reverted and the 2-MB blocksize bump of Bitcoin Classic was applied instead.

text.headline: Bip 101 was reverted and the 2-MB blocksize bump of Bitcoin Classic was applied instead.
text.text: Bitcoin Classic Release 0.11.2 release, Bip 101 was reverted and the 2-MB blocksize bump of Bitcoin Classic was applied instead.

media.caption: bitcoin Reward-Drop for the second time

text.headline: bitcoin Reward-Drop for the second time
text.text: bitcoin Reward-Drop for the second time at 2016-07-09 16:46:13-UTC: block 420000

media.caption: Bitfinex lost 119756btc

text.headline: Bitfinex lost 119756btc
text.text: 119,756 BTC lost in bitfinex hack!

media.caption: bitcoin hard folk split in two: bitcoin and bitcoin cash

text.headline: bitcoin hard folk split in two: bitcoin and bitcoin cash
text.text: A group of developers wanting to increase bitcoin's block size limit prepared a code change. The change, called a hard fork, took effect on 1 August 2017. As a result, the bitcoin ledger called the blockchain and the cryptocurrency split in two. At the time of the fork anyone owning bitcoin was also in possession of the same number of Bitcoin Cash units.

media.caption: Bitcoin Cash hard forlk split in two: bitcoin ABC and bitcoin SV

text.headline: Bitcoin Cash hard forlk split in two: bitcoin ABC and bitcoin SV
text.text: A hard-fork of Bitcoin Cash occurred between two rival groups called Bitcoin ABC and Bitcoin SV.

media.caption: Happy 10th birthday bitcoin!

text.headline: Happy 10th birthday bitcoin!
text.text:
Block 0, the genesis block, is established at 18:15:05 GMT.


genesis block，bitcoin has 10 years old today, Happy 10th birthday bitcoin!

media.caption: 7000 BTC hacked from Binance Exchange.

text.headline: Binance reports a loss of 7,000 BTC, valued at $42 million at current values.
text.text:
Binance has lost 7000 BTC from their hot wallet. This is 2% of their total bitcoin holdings. They have funds to cover customers according to their announcement.

Here is the transaction

media.caption: Happy 11th birthday bitcoin!

text.headline: Happy 11th birthday bitcoin!
text.text:
Block 0, the genesis block, is established at 18:15:05 GMT.


genesis block，bitcoin has 11 years old today, Happy 11th birthday bitcoin!

media.caption: The third Bitcoin Halving complete.

text.headline: The third Bitcoin Halving is now complete.
text.text: As of now, 630,000 blocks have been mined on the Bitcoin network, and the block reward has successfully halved for the THIRD time. The previous block reward was 12.5 BTC, and the new block reward is now 6.25 BTC. Since the previous halving at Block 210000, monetary inflation decreased from 4.17%% to 3.57%. Block 630000 signals an immediate 50% reduction to 1.79%. The next halving will occur at Block 840000 in approximately four years. Godspeed, Bitcoin!
